definition: muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to tumble/to fall head over heels/(fig.) to take a tumble

sentences.english: He threw a summersault on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 他在牀上翻了一個筋斗。

sentences.english: He practised standing on his head and turning somersaults .

sentences.chinese: 他一個筋斗翻出了窗戶。

sentences.english: He turned a somersault in the air.
sentences.chinese: 他在空中翻了一個筋斗。

sentences.english: Then old Mother Flipper-Flopper jumped out of bed.
sentences.chinese: 然後那老媽媽翻著筋斗跳下牀。

sentences.english: To perform acrobatic feats such as somersaults, rolls, or twists.
sentences.chinese: 表演雜技如翻筋斗，翻滾或旋轉。

sentences.english: The acrobats tumbled over the stage.
sentences.chinese: 雜技演員們在舞臺上翻筋斗。

sentences.english: I like standing on my head! I can do a somersault.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡倒立，我會翻筋斗。

sentences.english: Bunny playing happily in bed rolls, flips a somersault.
sentences.chinese: 小兔快樂地在牀上打起了滾，翻起了筋斗。

sentences.english: And when you did the outside loop last week.
sentences.chinese: 你上週駕飛機在空中翻筋斗。

sentences.english: The kinematics of helicopters in loop and roll maneuvers is analysed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文對筋斗和橫滾機動飛行的運動學問題進行了分析。

sentences.english: And he leapt into the air and did a little somersault.
sentences.chinese: 他跳到空中翻了一個小筋斗。

sentences.english: He did a flip after spinning around the high bar.
sentences.chinese: 他在高杆上旋轉身子之後翻了個筋斗。

definition: to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
to fall flat on one's face
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: to fall flat on one's face/(martial arts) pouncing and falling (i.e. all kinds of moves)
